newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia noon rubber up on technical adjustment.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia noon rubber up on technical adjustment.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices were higher at midday on technical adjustment while volumes remained thin, traders said.
They said the continuous weakness of the ringgit was keeping prices firm, but buyers were sidelined, seeking lower levels.
"It's quiet all over and I don't think it's going to change much, unless the ringgit comes up a bit," said one trader.
The ringgit was at 2.6480 against the U.S. dollar in Kuala Lumpur at 0200 GMT and was at 2.6490 by 0400 GMT.
At midday, both August Int. RSS buyer and August SMR 20 buyer were up a cent each to 244 cents (92 U.S. cents) a kg.
"It's more of a technical adjustment...there's no buying interest at the moment," said a government trading source.
Dealers offered SMR CV was 295 cents, SMR L at 275, SMR 5 at 253, SMR 10 at 244, SMR 20 at 243 and latex at 191 cents.
Malaysia-based shipping brokers quoted freight rates for rubber from Malaysia to Rotterdam at $700 per 20-ft container, and $1,400 per 40-ft container.
